sect2.title: Save Color Profile to File
sect2.para: Save Color Profile to File allows you to save to disk a copy of the ICC profile that's assigned to your image.

sect3.title: Activating the Command
sect3.para:
You can access this command from the main menu through
Image Color Management Save Color Profile to File… .

sect3.title: Usage Notes for the Command
sect3.para: Save Color Profile to File is useful whenever you want an on-disk copy of whatever ICC profile is assigned your image.
Save Color Profile to File can even be used to make an on-disk copy of GIMP's built-in sRGB profile.

sect3.title: An example with screenshots showing how to use Save Color Profile to File
sect3.para: Let's say you want to save a copy of the GIMP built-in sRGB profile to disk.

listitem.para: Open an image that has a GIMP built-in sRGB profile assigned.
Select ImageColor Management Save Color Profile to File…:
The "Save Color Profile" dialog is divided into three panels. Use the left and center panel to navigate to where you want to save the profile.

When you save a copy of the profile to disk, it's perfectly OK to change the suggested file name (some programs, and especially command line utilities, don't work as easily with file names that include spaces). If you change the file name, it's a good idea to use either ".icc" or ".icm" as the file extension (some programs won't recognize an ICC profile that uses some other file extension).
When you've chosen a location and typed in a file name, click on the Save button to save a copy of the profile to disk.
You can even also overwrite an existing ICC profile. After selecting an existing profile file, the right panel will show informational tags that are embedded in the selected profile.
